meanings.definition: To avoid work or responsibility by pretending to be busy or working.
meanings.sent1: She was goldbricking by rearranging her desk for the third time today.
meanings.sent2: He always tries goldbricking when it's time to clean his room.
meanings.sent3: The student was caught goldbricking by doodling on his notebook during class.
meanings.sent4: The cat was goldbricking by pretending to hunt while actually napping in the sun.
meanings.sent5: The employee was fired for goldbricking instead of completing the project on time.

meanings.definition: A person who avoids work or responsibility by pretending to be busy or working.
meanings.sent1: The goldbricking in the office is affecting productivity.
meanings.sent2: She was labeled as a goldbricking by her colleagues for always avoiding tasks.
meanings.sent3: The little boy thought he could get away with goldbricking by hiding behind a plant.
meanings.sent4: The fox in the fable was a goldbricking, lazy character who tricked others.
meanings.sent5: The manager had to address the issue of goldbricking among the team members.
